board.name: power
board.test: 1) Connect 12V to the battery input. Result: Main fuse LED should light

1) Insert 15A (Blue) fuse into lower slot. 2) Insert 1A (Black) fuse into slot on the rear of the board. 3) Plug in power switch. 4) Connect 12V to the battery input. 5) Close power switch. 6) Measure voltage on both 3.3V and 5V rails Result: Should draw around 30mA. (Both 3.3V rail and 5V rail will be on)
Check that the '3V3' and '5V' LEDs are on.
Plug 14V into the charger connector, ensure that this increases the battery input voltage to 14V.
1) Open power switch. 2) Connect UIF. 3) Close power switch. 4) Program MSP. 5) Run code. Result: Code runs.
1) Open power switch. 2) Hold down the two buttons to the lower right of the screen. 3) Close power switch. Result: Tune plays through piezo. CHARGE, debug(SRIC activity) and motor rail LEDs flash.
Press each button in turn, an LED should toggle. Press/turn rotary encoders, more LEDs should toggle.
Measure the voltage on the motor rail. Should be toggling between 0 and 12V.
Load the motor rail, preferably with 60W or more. Nothing should break, load should turn on/off.
Measure the voltage on the USB hub power socket. Should be 5V.
Ensure nothing higher than 1.8V is present on any of the BeagleBoard signal lines.

1) Open power switch. 2) Disconnect 12V from the battery input. 3) Mount BeagleBoard (remember the USB riser board). 4) Insert SD card with a test image into the BeagleBoard. 5) Plug serial cable into the BeagleBoard. 6) Connect 12V to the battery input. 7) Close power switch. 8) Wait about 1 minute for the BeagleBoard to boot. LED USR0 on the BealgeBoard should be flashing in a 'heartbeat' pattern and USR1 should be off. Result: Should draw around 165mA.
Measure LCD backlight voltage, should be anywhere between 32V and 39V.

1) Open power switch. 2) Disconnect 12V from the battery input. 3) Connect LCD. 4) Add insulating pad behind LCD. 5) Connect 12V to the battery input. 6) Close power switch. Result: Backlight should illuminate after 3 seconds.
Observe boot messages when the BeagleBoard boots. Check there are no errors reported. LCD should display things.
Run sricd and ensure it can enumerate a bus.
Control a motor board over SRIC
Connect a USB hub to the power board. Plug a memory stick and see if it mounts over the serial console.
